Sweeper scrubbers or sweepers and when we went into this originally we focused on scrubbers. Scrubbers don't necessarily pick up debris which it gets clocked up. It gets there's a lot of issues when it comes to downtime with scrubbers in a warehouse setting. And so it's truly causing a challenge when it comes to operation and we saw it during peak big time.
Keith Deuber.action: Q1-Q2 2026: (1) Work with procurement on existing sites + idle asset list, (2) Bill Darlington assessing equipment at warehouse, (3) Swap out scrubbers for sweepers at current sites, (4) Create equipment list for upcoming sites - 'Know which ones we need for which site types,' (5) Ready to order correct equipment when capturing new sites, (6) Lessons learned: warehouse = debris/dust = sweepers; offices = floors = scrubbers, (7) Peak proactive response: had 10+ equipment rental agencies ready, got equipment same/next day - maintain this contingency approach

I mean, if you're on budget and you're just making money, it's really important.'

let them lead vs Jacob leading, Position them as go-to contacts for their areas, TIMELINE: Set specific date (3-6 months from now = April-July 2026) when Francisco and Edgar are primary client contacts, Set monthly milestones for client interactions, (2) MIT PROGRAM FOR SUPERVISORS: CURRENT STATUS: Started this month (January 2026), Selected 3 supervisors: 'hearty and ambitious', 'Shown they understand the capacity and need of Tesla', GOAL: Show them what's expected of operations manager, Create backup plan for quick deployment ('not a run around free for all'), Example: 'Gloria's going to be the OPS manager of the data center', TIMELINE: Set MIT program completion date (what month?), Set operations manager promotion timeline for successful graduates, Define 'what is expected of OPS manager' - document this, (3) CUSTODIAL SUPERVISORS DEVELOPMENT: Getting into mindset that 'next step is operations manager', Creating pipeline of leadership talent, Not waiting for 'bricks to fall' and then 'shove a brick in there', (4) STRATEGIC RATIONALE: Tesla concern: 'Things will get stretched too thin' with scope expansion, Jacob's response: Show strong leadership structure can handle growth, External building, data centers, robo taxi = need more leaders, 'These are the leaders you can lean on', (5) CLIENT VISIBILITY MILESTONES (3-6 MONTH PLAN): Month 1-2: Francisco and Edgar handling specific projects with Nico visibility, Month 3-4: Francisco and Edgar leading client meetings with Jacob attending, Month 5-6: Francisco and Edgar as primary contacts, Jacob in background, Throughout: MIT supervisors shadowing, learning, preparing for next level, (6) ACCOUNTABILITY: Set specific date for leadership handoff milestone review, Define success metrics: Client feedback on Francisco/Edgar?, Number of client interactions they lead?, Problems resolved independently?, (7) EXPANSION PREPAREDNESS: Once leadership proven, ready for: Data center (Dojo) RFP - Gloria as OPS manager?, External buildings - Francisco or Edgar leading?, Robo taxi scope - dedicated leader?, New scope = new leaders ready to deploy

Jeremy Johnson.title: Make Personal Goals SMART - Specific, Dated, Actionable
Jeremy Johnson.quote: Valarie: 'Your lowest score was your personal professional goals... I would love to hear your personal goal. I want to be able to give you all the credit in the world... What are your personal goals in a SMART format?' Jeremy: 'I want to force myself out of my comfort zone to learn something new.' Valarie: 'That's not very specific. Do you want to learn Lam Research? Life sciences? Technology and AI innovation at ForoInsight? What is your specific thing? When do you want it done by?' Jeremy: 'By Q3... broaden my horizon beyond Intel.' Valarie: 'I would agree. I definitely think you could take on more once you get through this RFP situation. Your brain has the capacity to learn a specialty different than something you know today.'
Jeremy Johnson.action: Define personal goal in SMART format: (1) Specific: What domain? (Lam Research, life sciences, tech/AI at ForoInsight, etc.), (2) Measurable: How will success be defined?, (3) Dated: By Q3 2026 (per Jeremy's commitment), (4) Actionable: Concrete steps to broaden beyond Intel

Jeremy Johnson.title: Bring Someone Under Your Wing - Develop 'Jeremy Part 2'
Jeremy Johnson.quote: Valarie: 'I challenge you to bring someone specifically under your wing. SBM is at a major disadvantage that someone is not with you at all times, observing, listening, learning. You should have a recent college graduate at 2-6, maybe 2-8 years max that all they do is follow you around. They go to meetings with you, they help you organize, you correct them non-stop, train with you for ~6 months. Then you say to me, Valarie, I've had this person, they really could take on that next monster account. I want a Jeremy Part 2. The only thing you can do for me is give me someone else who can operate at the level that you do.'
Jeremy Johnson.action: Identify shadow/mentee: Recent college grad (2-8 years max); have them follow Jeremy to meetings, whiteboarding sessions (e.g. with Mark Schlerf, Alex Kennedy); 6-month training commitment; define success metrics for mentorship; goal: person ready to take on next monster account

Jeremy Johnson.title: Include Amani (and Future Mentees) in Key Meetings
Jeremy Johnson.quote: Valarie: 'Do you take her to meetings like this one? Is she in the room with you and Mark Schlerf when you whiteboard? Is she in the room?' Jeremy: 'No, not as much as she could be. We'll give ourselves grace in first 60 days.' Valarie: 'If you're pouring into Amani, what are your measurements of success whether you've mentored her well or not?'
Jeremy Johnson.action: Include Amani in: Strategic calls (like this review), Whiteboarding sessions with Mark Schlerf/Alex Kennedy, Key client and leadership meetings; Define mentorship success metrics

Jeremy Johnson.title: Prep Air Freshener Pilot for Broader Ops Call
Jeremy Johnson.quote: Valarie: 'We need to share that on the bigger, broader monthly call. So please prep for that or have Alyssa actually prep to speak to everyone on the bigger, broader monthly call for all of operations and in that maybe have some costs and things.'
Jeremy Johnson.action: Prepare air freshener pilot presentation for broader ops monthly call; Include Alyssa (Amazon) to present; Include cost data (20% savings) and end user feedback (90% favorable)

Jeremy Johnson.title: Flush Out Clean Room Technology Differentiation & Timeline
Jeremy Johnson.quote: Valarie: 'When do you think you'll have a solution for a clean room? What's your plan? Flush that out just a little bit more as far as what the differentiation will be. We don't currently know what that is, but the goal will be to discover the differentiators for clean room space.' Jeremy: 'Every floor task in clean room is completely manual. If we introduce technology that takes away mop and bucket - significant safety, ergonomic, cost savings. Hurdle is making change to controlled environment. LAM has Safety iMop on site - goal to put hands on in Q1, proposal out Q2. Intel moves slower - implementation by end of year.'
Jeremy Johnson.action: Document clean room differentiation: Manual-to-automated value prop; safety/ergonomic/cost savings; Q1: hands on LAM Safety iMop; Q2: proposal to Intel; End of year: Implementation target

RJ Ober.title: Get Specific Date for Budget Correction / Cost Increase
RJ Ober.quote: Valarie: 'Do you have how you're gonna get it on budget? When will we have a date? When will we know about increasing our costs to offset how bad we are upside down?' Valarie: 'Our contract is technically over and we're going to wait until after the RFP process. What's the timeline on the RFP?' Valarie: 'That's the most pressing question I have about IBM, just the budget.'
RJ Ober.action: Establish specific timeline: When does RFP process start? When will pricing/cost increase decisions be made? Communicate date to leadership for when budget correction is expected

RJ Ober.title: Loop in Melissa Hampton - JLL Executive Sponsor
RJ Ober.quote: Nick: 'We shouldn't be - if you haven't already - looped in Melissa Hampton who's overseeing our executive sponsor over the JLL portfolio to get involved in those conversations early and often, especially with your end scorecards coming up. That opportunity to connect her and let her be some connective tissue in the background that continues to drive the relationship and speak to some of the innovation opportunities.'
RJ Ober.action: Connect Melissa Hampton (JLL executive sponsor) early and often; leverage for end scorecard reviews; use as connective tissue for innovation conversations (e.g. mobile conversion, AI audits)

RJ Ober.title: Implement AI/Real-Time Audits - Get Sticky Before June
RJ Ober.quote: Nick: 'Have you showed them or would they have any interest in what we're doing with real time validations and AI assessments? We've gone from 400 audits a month to 2000 a day at La Guardia. We have a short window to get really sticky... these next couple of QBRs are going to be so important. Leverage Melissa on the solution side to have those conversations and try to get something implemented now.'
RJ Ober.action: Show IBM/JLL real-time audits and AI validations (La Guardia example); set up walkthrough with Nick; aim to implement before June renewal; leverage Melissa Hampton for solution-side conversations

RJ Ober.title: Austin Transition - Partner with Transitions Team & Good Trainer
RJ Ober.quote: Valarie: 'Who from the transitions team will be supporting? I just want to make sure you partner with a good trainer.' Valarie: 'It's a 90 day transition which is really long for us - we typically transition in 30 days. I'd like to understand that a little bit more - who you're partnered with, who's going to own it. You'll be owning it from customer facing perspective, but from an operations perspective they can't leave that on you - you don't know what you're doing yet.'
RJ Ober.action: Identify transitions team support; partner with experienced trainer; clarify operational ownership (R.J = customer facing; operations team = operational execution); understand 90-day timeline rationale

RJ Ober.title: Deepen Operational Understanding - Stay Through Transition
RJ Ober.quote: Valarie: 'It's gonna be important that you start digging into to the best of your ability to understand the overall operation. Getting on the transition staying from start to finish - not meaning you have to stay there for four weeks or 90 days, but you do need to be in a position where you can get those set up and running and be paying close attention to operations because you learn the most through the transition process.'
RJ Ober.action: Be present through Austin transition start to finish; dig into overall operation; pay close attention to operations; use transition as learning opportunity

RJ Ober.title: Document Scope Misalignment Origin & Corrective Steps
RJ Ober.quote: Yousef: 'Regarding scope alignment, I would have appreciated additional detail on how the misalignment originated and whether any corrective steps were taken before end user concerns surfaced and the final resolution was reached. It would also be helpful to understand how our partnership and working relationship with JLL influenced the process and outcome.'
RJ Ober.action: Document: (1) How scope misalignment originated, (2) Corrective steps taken before vs after end user concerns, (3) How JLL partnership influenced process and outcome
